item.description:
We will explore some of the trails in the 200 acre Pulpit Rock    Conservation Area off of New Boston Rd in Bedford, NH. 
The conservation area sign is a little set back from the road so you have to be looking for it. It is very close to the Bedford/New Boston town line. The address 593 New Boston Road, Bedford, NH is on the other side of the road very close to where the parking lot and sign for Pulpit Rock Conservation Area is. One can very easily be seen from the other. In the second picture the car is coming out of the Pulpit Rock parking lot

From Route 114 in Bedford the conservation area is about 5.7 miles heading west on New Boston Rd. Heading west on New Boston Rd from Wallace Rd it is about 3.7 miles and will be on your left having just pasted a mailbox and street number for 593 New Boston road on your right.

Coming from New Boston on Chestnut Hill Road which at the town line becomes New Boston Rd. in Bedford the conservation area parking lot and sign is less than 0.1 of a mile on the right. After passing the town line on your left in the third picture the parking lot is the first right and can be seen from the town line.  A mailbox for 599 New Boston Rd. is also just below the town line and and Sanford sign.

Here is a link to a trail map:

http://www.nhmountainhiking.com/hike/pulpit...

group.name: Human Soles & Doggie Paws Hikers & Walkers of Manchester, NH

item.name: Pulpit Rock 3 mile hike
